channel.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
channel.description:
Lately I've been seeing that SCAR is being dissed by MANY
people. After i saw a former SCAR scripter Underestimate SCAR,
i fealt (sp?) it had gone too far. Please post possible reasons
why this is happening and how it can be stopped. I do NOT
the general public seeing this so i'll post this here

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs

[me=Pwnd]hits ruler with www.dictionary.com[/me]

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

yes but that just reqs additional code its not a design problem that requires a whole new bot. You can get all those coordinates in aryan as is. I have started adding mouse events. Just have to write new methods and menu handelers/bank handler.

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

design flaws as in using doAction() at all ruler, you need to use coordinates and mouseevents for EVERYTHING

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Nerice:

Dont ban me for bringing this off topic thread back on topic ok.

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=1332.msg12393#msg12393 date=1144796631]
Java bots have taken over, reguardless of how shitty they are.

Agreed.

[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=1332.msg12513#msg12513 date=1144806766]
If you want both undetectablility and money, then you need to develop your own java bot from scratch, no use trying to "fix" somthing as detectable as aryan, its better to start over and write a bot that only extracts info (in a non-interfering threadsafe way) from the client and sends mouseevents and keyevents to do the work, and keep it private (of course this would also be rather easily killed, depending on how you did your renaming, and how much you know)
[/quote]

Agreed with this as well. I spent so much time getting my version to the point its at now, and after looking back, its all wasted. I have done alot of good, but really, I could had already just made one by now proabably. Aryan started out with design flaws that just takes too much to overcome all the way. Dont get me wrong, it was a great bot at one time. Props to the devs that created it and looking at the source jump started me tremendesly on my own endeavors.

I talk to people to try to get an idea if they would be someone good to work with, and everyone wants to try to fix Aryan. I wish them good luck, but I am beyond that stage of thinking for good, its not even an option I will consider. (No time to actyally do alot of work is causing me major problems though.)

Yeah, Extract the data out of the client, and then 100% mouse/key events sent to the applet is the way to go. Filling the mouse movement arrays is ok/decent, not ideal, but a short term fix and is not as undetectable as real events.

Public Aryan's are screwed...(I have no motivation to make it better and it it out for all the idiots) Havent dug through rulers source, but from experience I am pretty sure he has at least partially wasted his time. In the end all of it probably. :)[/quote]
haha not all of my time is wasted yet :). Well if one does dev a bot that uses just key/mouse actions most aryan scripts can be converted to be compliant with some work. (tiles,object ID's) Now why can't aryan be made into this bot? Design flaws in what areas? Keep in mind the current detection methods don't req all mouse/key events. In theory they might in the long term.

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Dont ban me for bringing this off topic thread back on topic ok.

Pwnd:

Java bots have taken over, reguardless of how shitty they are.

Agreed.

moparisthebest:

If you want both undetectablility and money, then you need to develop your own java bot from scratch, no use trying to "fix" somthing as detectable as aryan, its better to start over and write a bot that only extracts info (in a non-interfering threadsafe way) from the client and sends mouseevents and keyevents to do the work, and keep it private (of course this would also be rather easily killed, depending on how you did your renaming, and how much you know)

Agreed with this as well. I spent so much time getting my version to the point its at now, and after looking back, its all wasted. I have done alot of good, but really, I could had already just made one by now proabably. Aryan started out with design flaws that just takes too much to overcome all the way. Dont get me wrong, it was a great bot at one time. Props to the devs that created it and looking at the source jump started me tremendesly on my own endeavors.

I talk to people to try to get an idea if they would be someone good to work with, and everyone wants to try to fix Aryan. I wish them good luck, but I am beyond that stage of thinking for good, its not even an option I will consider. (No time to actyally do alot of work is causing me major problems though.)

Yeah, Extract the data out of the client, and then 100% mouse/key events sent to the applet is the way to go. Filling the mouse movement arrays is ok/decent, not ideal, but a short term fix and is not as undetectable as real events.

Public Aryan's are screwed...(I have no motivation to make it better and it it out for all the idiots) Havent dug through rulers source, but from experience I am pretty sure he has at least partially wasted his time. In the end all of it probably.

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

VG_Kobra:

American Automakers are following European Footsteps, if you notice the Ford Fusion you will notice that they say it has European Styling. GM is also diminishing, It closed a few plants in Oklahoma and some in Canada. American Customs may be good by I'd say the general consumer market is slipping and fast.

Ford owns jaguar and alot of other european companies, and mopar cries has merged to make daimler chrysler, which owns mercedes, so of course since they are now the same companies some of the european crap designs are making their way over here, for the most part if you want a good quality automobile you have to look for cars at least 1990 or older

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs

@VG_Kobra wrote:

Same here but I'm opting for Software instead of Physical.

American Automakers are following European Footsteps, if you notice the Ford Fusion you will notice that they say it has European Styling. GM is also diminishing, It closed a few plants in Oklahoma and some in Canada. American Customs may be good by I'd say the general consumer market is slipping and fast.

item.title: SCAR Popularity Going Down? Or Just Noobs
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

VG_Kobra:

[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=1332.msg13331#msg13331 date=1144944084]
[quote author=VG_Kobra link=topic=1332.msg13327#msg13327 date=1144943265]
I know a 454 is not a Hemi. By Hemi I just meant the raw power that most American Shopping CartI mean cars have. Dodge has been milking that crap in every car in its line up from the SRT10 to the Charger.

Oh you probably can, most street legal cars can. I was talking about those mundane
Dragsters. Whats horsepower when there are no reigns to tame it?

again you are wrong, the SRT10 has a 8.2? liter 508 cubic inch aluminum block V10 motor in it, its not a hemi (and hemis have been around since the first hemi in a car, the awesome 1951 Chrysler 300 :D)

and dragsters are awesome in thier own right

(you still dont know enough about cars to argue with me, grab a book :D)
[/quote]

I'll stay in my area you stay in yours, I don't think I want to learn about Obese Fuel Tanks and nor do you want to learn about the sophistication of German Engineering. I don't learn from books I learn from experience. Mainly because my cousin is a mechanic. He owns a American Car (unfortunately) Plymouth Barracuda.

Leave it to the Americans to put a Racebred Engine in a Pickup Truck.

Just pretend we do not exist and continue with SCAR or Aryan or whatever this thread was about :P[/quote]

your cousin is a smart man, owning an awesome mopar like that and all

and I know from experiance, I have worked on many many cars, Im also studying to be a mechanical engineer, foriegn engineering basically sucks when compared to american engineering in every aspect, they simply wouldnt know how to build a good solid decent car if it bit them in the ass

Read full topic
